page.title: 05TEMPLETON FARM.
page.content: Mr Davies gets up at 6:00am.He starts milking at 6:30am and finishes at around 8:00am.The milk is collected at 8:30am.Mr Davies has 40 milk and 60 beef cattle and about 150 ewes and lambs.He rents his 100 acre farm.He has 7 acres of barley and the rest is grass used for silage,grazing and hay.He employs one man to help him with the milking.He has a river and a small stream.He likes his job.He has 4 tractors,a mower,a plough,a disk,a shearing machine,a hay_bob,a roller,2 trailers,a corn drill,hay elevator and a silage grab.In spring he ploughs,harrows and spreads muck.In summer he shears sheep and harvests hay,silage and corn.In autumn he harvests potatoes and cuts the hedges. In winter he feeds the cattle twice a day and repairs fences.The farm is 385 years old.
